reviewText: Good tips.
He's ideal for intermediate wood workers, Too repetitive for advanced wood workers, doesn't convey all techniques for beginners, some vital information is skipped over.

Tommy really has an ability to encourage newer woodworkers while also providing challenges for
the more advanced. Superb quality videos! Detailed paper plans come with every episode! I hope to eventually own every episode of every season!
Great woodworking tips and techniques. Does a great job of showing hand tools (which I prefer).
Dull
very good show projects are a bit simple, but good advice on woodworking techniques.
Enjoyed watching, not as many road trips this season
Gives a great outline and tips but plan to buy the plans and more resurch
Nice Show.  Host seems to be very knowledgeable and likeable.  Good job.
Great show my local PBS dropped it nice to be able to see it again
Great regular guy. Wish he had more shows. He funny and really informative.
Great show love it.
relaxing
One of my favorite woodworking shows.

My only complaint would be that the program is not long enough. Tommy does a road trip segment where he looks at historic pieces of furniture which eats up show time. Still good program just needs more time.

I've always found Tommy Mac's stecato speech and cutesy approach distracting to the enjoyment of a woodworking show.  I've seen him on earlier TOH shows and he was easier to listen to.  Like some of the other reviews, I find it skips over a lot of detail and really doesn't have a smooth flow.  A New Yankee Workshop replacement this isn't, and there certainly have been better woodworking shows on.
Interesting projects, and he explains them well.
Just ok
My husband really enjoys this

Rough Cut is fairly easy to follow for the woodworking part and the tool maintenance is also easy to follow.  However, some of the tools used are out of the price range of many viewers.

There are many episodes that only require lower priced tools.

I have learned what goes into making high quality items.
Tommy Mac always has a good show

Not as thorough as new Yankee workshop. Definitely steps left out of process. More for entertainment than for woodworkers.
But tommy is an amusing personality.
Good and to the  point.
